intro: Ecbolium setaceum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Ecbolium setaceum is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often toxic species.
